<post description="Flight & Expulsion" extended="interactive map depicting refugees migrations "Based on the annual UNHCR Refugee Report, the application allows views from different perspectives on the extensive dataset, highlighting different aspects. The idea for this visualization originated from a class project on the topic of mapping global tendencies at Potsdam University of Applied Sciences in 2008. The current application's interface was completely rebuilt in late 2009."" hash="7f64491d6953ffb0da5ced1d669cc095" href="http://www.niceone.org/lab/refugees/" private="no" shared="yes" tag="history time violence map visualization [project]" time="2012-09-28T23:03:37Z"/>

<post description="Twitter Dashboard - Interactive - Al Jazeera English" extended="twitter dashboard on convulsed arab countries "As uprisings turn to revolutions in the Middle East, Al Jazeera's New Media team releases a Twitter Dashboard that illustrates what is being tweeted about and where.The tool is split into four sections that track tweets on Egypt, Libya, Yemen and Bahrain."" hash="f58150892bd540de30849e31f08dc314" href="http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/interactive/2011/03/20113108250282747.html" private="no" shared="yes" tag="[project] history news Africa twitter visualization time statistics" time="2011-03-22T21:44:20Z"/>
<post description="The mathematics of beauty" extended="Analysis on how man rate women on OkCupid "This post investigates female attractiveness, but without the usual photo analysis stuff. Instead, we look past a woman's picture, into the reaction she creates in the reptile mind of the human male."" hash="318deb826c4aacabbd2f604007944304" href="http://blog.okcupid.com/index.php/the-mathematics-of-beauty/" private="no" shared="yes" tag="psychology !!! [post_blog] sociology statistics visualization humor information photography internet ! !!" time="2011-01-18T16:00:58Z"/>
<post description="Which generation do you belong to?" extended="Quiz + visualization from USA TODAY "The generation you belong to isn't just about the year of your birth, but about your cultural experiences. Take this quiz and pick which fashion trends, news events, movies, TV shows or toys you remember from your formative years. Then we'll match you up with your generation. Ready? Let's get started!"" hash="d5b74823b495a87b19a414e14f040c0c" href="http://projects.usatoday.com/news/generations/quiz/" private="no" shared="yes" tag="[project] USA popular time life news music movies sport visualization" time="2010-11-17T23:31:39Z"/>
<post description="Red Queen" extended="The Red Queen's Hypothesis, Red Queen, "Red Queen's race" or "Red Queen Effect" is an evolutionary hypothesis. The term is taken from the Red Queen's race in Lewis Carroll's Through the Looking-Glass. The Red Queen said, "It takes all the running you can do, to keep in the same place." The Red Queen Principle can be stated thus: "For an evolutionary system, continuing development is needed just in order to maintain its fitness relative to the systems it is co-evolving with."" hash="f5d7d9463ed6b8f28f48b3d9dad5ffb6" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Queen" private="no" shared="yes" tag="[wikipedia_article] science biology genetics evolution sociology ecology complexity life" time="2010-01-30T21:06:32Z"/>

"" hash="06af5c682bd300e6221467b9505600d0" href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z3W5aw-VKKA" private="no" shared="yes" tag="[video_youtube] physics emergence complexity kinetics science" time="2009-12-04T01:44:14Z"/>
<post description="Between The Folds - a film by Vanessa Gould" extended=""This film is much more than a loving look at the fascinating, brilliant characters who devote their lives to folding paper. It reveals origami itself as richer and more intricate than you could imagine... and by the end, you find yourself convinced that the mystery of folding could be one of the universe's deep secrets."" hash="d237ccd88e095bc6c6a736ec39c3b527" href="http://www.greenfusefilms.com/index.html" private="no" shared="yes" tag="[video] movies math science art design paper origami history video ! !!" time="2009-12-04T00:04:13Z"/>

<post description="visualcomplexity.com | reMap" extended=""It took a while for reMap to be featured here, but it was probably worth the wait, since it's an extremely suitable project to occupy the 700th entry on VisualComplexity.com."" hash="ba8e8d722bb9b0914beccd202f40169d" href="http://www.visualcomplexity.com/vc/project_details.cfm?id=700&index=700&domain=" private="no" shared="yes" tag="vc bestiario ego visualization tags network interaction interface" time="2009-10-05T21:59:19Z"/>
<post description="Hunch" extended=""In 10 questions or less, Hunch will offer you a great solution to your problem, concern or dilemma, on hundreds of topics. Hunch's answers are based on the collective knowledge of the entire Hunch community, narrowed down to people like you, or just enough like you that you might be mistaken for each other in a dark room. Hunch is designed so that every time it's used, it learns something new. That means Hunch's hunches are always getting better"." hash="a232aa72ba020101fd061614a1705614" href="http://www.hunch.com/" private="no" shared="yes" tag="[project] internet community logic algorithm humor tool" time="2009-06-29T16:32:41Z"/>
<post description="WikiStart/en - Spark project" extended="Spark project is Open source community to develop Flash/ActionScripts. It is managed under the desire "Let's share the source code and knowhow by everyone, and become happy"." hash="f31f5036b0c661b46e84b1e76d6cdb9b" href="http://www.libspark.org/wiki/WikiStart/en" private="no" shared="yes" tag="[project] [compilation] community flash code actionscript algorithm tool !" time="2009-06-19T12:40:40Z"/>
<post description="Open Library (Open Library)" extended=""One web page for every book ever published. It's a lofty, but achievable, goal."" hash="a81be65bde5449cd8048a42c5d64efd3" href="http://openlibrary.org/" private="no" shared="yes" tag="[project] education internet literature books information [dataRepository]" time="2009-06-14T20:31:59Z"/>
<post description="Home | OpenCalais" extended=""We want to make all the world's content more accessible, interoperable and valuable. Some call it Web 2.0, Web 3.0, the Semantic Web or the Giant Global Graph - we call our piece of it Calais." ···> safari" hash="9defea2933da4e61453c21c8071df172" href="http://opencalais.com/" private="no" shared="yes" tag="[project] ! !! [dataRepository] network internet information [compilation] community" time="2009-06-12T19:44:13Z"/>
<post description="Socrata | Making Data Social" extended=""Opening government to new audiences and constituencies is the 21st century battle cry in societies everywhere. At the heart of this movement is open government data, readily accessible over the internet, in a form that maximizes comprehension, interactivity, participation, and sharing, delivered at a fraction of the cost of today's data download sites."" hash="4e2720188cf81bc5bd38ed38c8ee30b6" href="http://www.socrata.com/" private="no" shared="yes" tag="[dataRepository] politics statistics information" time="2009-06-03T15:46:57Z"/>
<post description="isometricblocks | ben fry" extended=""When comparing the genome of two different people, you'll see single letter changes (called SNPs, pronounced "snips") every few thousand letters. An interesting feature of SNPs is that their ordering has distinct patterns, where sets of consecutive changes are most often found together. There are many methods for looking at this data, so this piece combines several of them into a single visual display. The project is described in greater detail in my dissertation, starting in chapter four. "" hash="078193e432a25331e394b8f831bf8c49" href="http://benfry.com/isometricblocks/" private="no" shared="yes" tag="[project] ! !! interaction flow ben_fry genetics biology science visualization evolution java bioinformatics processing code information" time="2009-05-20T13:34:42Z"/>
<post description="Scale-free network" extended="a network whose degree distribution follows a power law, at least asymptotically. That is, the fraction P(k) of nodes in the network having k connections to other nodes goes for large values of k as P(k) ~ k−γ where γ is a constant whose value is typically in the range 2<γ<3, although occasionally it may lie outside these bounds. Scale-free networks are noteworthy because many empirically observed networks appear to be scale-free, including the world wide web, protein networks, citation networks, and some social networks." hash="ba5d48aa20572856e76beb07c1143344" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scale-free_networks" private="no" shared="yes" tag="[wikipedia_article] network social_network graph math topology !" time="2009-05-14T18:33:47Z"/>
<post description="ReubenMiller : Take-G - Futuristic Woodworking" extended="" fusion of age-old craft technique and futuristic dreams, Take-G Toys are an astonishing collection of toys that are made from natural wood. Each of these toys are hand-made by Takeji (Take-G) Nakagawa in Japan. Unfortunately, for most of us, these are not available outside of Japan. I'd love to see these in an exhibit so I can get real close to check out the details."" hash="ad29e4b81797a2a940fd278704966001" href="http://reubenmiller.typepad.com/my_weblog/2008/01/take-g---futuri.html" private="no" shared="yes" tag="[post_blog] art art_craft games education sculpture wood toy" time="2009-05-02T11:31:18Z"/>

<post description="Spamghetto 640×481 pixels" extended=""we decided to save some junk-mail in order to turn it into a wallpaper for your house before it's too late: someday a brilliant scientist will find the definitive solution to eradicate from the web the bittersweet pleasure of spam." source: http://www.todo.to.it/#projects/spamghetto" hash="9e4892c5ef529ef186aa9f83b5b12b8a" href="http://www.todo.to.it/images/projs/spamghetto_showcase/ToDo_Spamghetto_06.jpg" private="no" shared="yes" tag="[image] black_and_white text typography plants tree spam art patterns design architecture filetype:jpg media:image" time="2009-05-01T11:01:21Z"/>
<post description="lichtenberg_figure.jpg 687×364 pixels" extended="Lightning Strikes and Electrical Discharge creates fractal formations called Lichtenberg figures on rocks, grass,wood or even people! From Tennessee's Oak-Ridge Laboratory Museum "This particular Lichtenberg Figure was created by exposing a rotating lucite cylinder to the electron beam. When the cylinder was discharged by striking one end with a grounded rod, the electrons created a three dimensional Lichtenberg Figure. Size: 12.5 " long, 2" diameter" hash="11f604b6c10d5d5b4fd331a20d4ada7f" href="http://www.miqel.com/images_1/fractal_math_patterns/natural-patterns/lichtenberg_figure.jpg" private="no" shared="yes" tag="[image] fractals tree patterns chemistry geology electricity photography filetype:jpg media:image" time="2009-04-17T10:27:31Z"/>
<post description=""There are some things that only the intellect is able to seek, but which it will never find by itself. Those things could only be found by instinct, but it shall never seek them.”" extended="" hash="e8568e3c5f7a8f426acc8f6d40241cb9" href="http://Bergson/" private="no" shared="yes" tag="[quote] brain philosophy psychology cognition" time="2009-04-13T12:18:26Z"/>
